title: Door Curtain (Noren)
text: Indigo dyed cotton door curtains (<I>noren<I>) were typically hung across the entrances or gateways to homes in traditional Japan. Unlike professionally produced <I>noren<I> for shops and businesses, <I>noren<I> for private homes were typically designed and decorated by the home's mistress. This beautiful example shows a flock of red-crested cranes--long symbols of longevity in Asia--flying amid clouds and standing in a field of autumn grasses.
description: four panels stitched together; indigo sky/ground with white clouds and grasses; red and brown resist dyed cranes, with seven flying birds and other birds on ground; mounted on board
